description: Uncertain, but probably an aphetic form of French alphonse (“kept man”), from the male given name Alphonse. Also sometimes connected to pounce or French pensionnaire (“pensioner, person living without working”).

definitionGroups.group: (UK, Ireland, Australia, New Zealand, derogatory, slang) A man living off another's earnings, especially a woman's.

entries.meaning: Synonym of pimp, especially one hired by a prostitute as a tout, bodyguard, and driver. [1872]
(Britain, Australia, New Zealand, Ireland, derogatory, slang) Synonym of poof: an effeminate male homosexual; any similarly effeminate man. [1932]

verbs.description: ponce (third-person singular simple present ponces, present participle poncing, simple past and past participle ponced) (UK, slang)

entries.meaning: (by extension) To try to get rid of or sell something.
To borrow (something) from somebody without returning it.
(derogatory) To behave in a posh or effeminate manner.
(Louisiana) The stomach of a pig, especially when stuffed as chaudin (a Louisianan food).
